[s:śubhamastu sarvajagatāṃ] may every creature be happy {55 one སྐད་གོ་འདུན་ལ་}
CLXXIII On the names or terms of the four kinds of intrepidity of Tathāgata
[s:Sarvadharmā bhisambodhi vaiśāradyaṃ] intrepidity (or boldness for becoming accomplished in all things (or moral virtues). {5/1 one དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི་མི་འཇིགས་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Sarvāsravakṣaya jñāna-vaiśāradyaṃ] intrepidity in knowing that all (his) imperfections have ended or have come to an end {5/2 one དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི་མི་འཇིགས་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Antarāyikadharmānanyathātva niścita vyākaraṇa vaiśāradyaṃ] boldness to teach (or prophesy) with certainty the immutability of the immanent virtues. {5/3 one དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི་མི་འཇིགས་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Sarva sampadadhigamāya niryāṇika pratipattathātva vaiśāradyaṃ] intrepidity in turning (going) to the path which is the surest means for arriving at perfection or excellence of every kind. {5/4 one དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི་མི་འཇིགས་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
CLXXIV The names or the eighteen unmixed or pure virtues (or qualities of Buddha)
[s:Nāsti Tathāgatasya skhalitaṃ] there is no error or mistake in Tathagata (or he is exempt from, etc,). {6/1 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nāsti ravitaṃ] there is no noise (or he is without, etc.). {6/2 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nāsti muṣita smṛtitā] there is no forgetfulness in him. {6/3 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nāstyasamāhita cittaṃ] there is no unmindfulness. {6/4 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nāsti nānātva saṃjñā] there is no different thought or representation in him. {6/5 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nāstyapratisaṃkhyā yopekṣā] there is no indifference (in him) for any undiscussed things. {6/6 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nāsti chandasya hāniḥ] there is no privation (or diminution) of wish or zeal (in him). {6/7 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nāsti vīryasya hāniḥ] there is no diminution or relaxation of diligent application. {6/8 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nāsti smṛti hāniḥ] he has no impaired memory. {6/9 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nāsti samādher hāniḥ] there is no diminution in his deep meditation. {6/10 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nasti prajñayā hāniḥ] there is no privation in his understanding. {6/11 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nāsti vimukter hāniḥ] there is no relaxation from being liberated or emancipated. {6/12 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Sarva kayākarma jñāna pūrvaṅgamaṃ jñānānu-parivartti] all his bodily actions (or works) are preceded by his discretion (and follow his understanding). {6/13 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Sarva vākkarma jñāna pūrvaṅgamaṃ jñānānu parivartti] all his words (or actions relating to speech) are preceded by discretion (and follow his understanding). {6/14 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Sarva manaskarma jñāna pūrvaṅgamaṃ jñānānu parivartti] all his mental works, (or actions) are preceded by discretion (and follow his understanding). {6/15 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Atīte-dhvanyasaṅgama pratithaṃ jñānadarśanaṃ pravarttate] occupied with the contemplation of the wisdom which has been neither attracted nor hindered by the time that has hitherto elapsed {6/16 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Anāgate-dhvanyasaṅgama pratihataṃ jñāna darśanaṃ pravarttate] occupied with the contemplation of the wisdom which has been neither attracted nor hindered by the time that will come hereafter (or by the future). {6/17 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Pratyutpanne-dhvanya saṅgama pratihataṃ jñāna darśanaṃ pravarttate] occupied with the contemplation of the wisdom which has been neither attracted nor hindered by the present time. {6/18 one སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Nirātmānah sarva-dharmāḥ sattvāś ca nairātmyaṃ nâdhimucyante. Atas tathāgagatasya sattveṣu mahā-karuṇôtpadyate] all things are without any self-existent substance within them [nirātmānaḥ = without any essence] but the animate existences do not therefore in acknowledge it; therefore in Tathāgata arises great commiseration for the animate beings. {7/1 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Niḥsattvāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are without a self-existing principle, [personal identity]. {7/2 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Nirjīvāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are without any principle of life. {7/3 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Niṣpudgalāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are without an individual soul (or inward man). {7/4 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Abhāvāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] nothing does exist by itself [all things are without any real existence]. {7/5 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Aniketāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are without having a place [without a substratum]. {7/6 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Anālayāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are without a fundamental abode. {7/7 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Amamāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are without appropriation [things are not of a nature of being claimed-as one's own]. {7/8 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Asvāmikāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are without a proprietor. {7/9 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Avastukāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are without a material substance [without any reality]. {7/10 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Ajātāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] nothing has come forth by itself [things are without genesis]. {7/11 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Acyutā anutpannāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] things neither die (perish) nor come forth (i.e. everything exists without end and beginning) {7/12 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Asaṅkliṣṭāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are exempt from distress natural corruption [things are not subject to contamination]. {7/13 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Vigatta-rāgāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are exempt from passion (or fondness for anything). {7/14 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Vigata-dveṣāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are exempt from aversion. {7/15 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Vigata-mohāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are exempt from ignorance. {7/16 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Anāgatikāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are sui generis. {7/17 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Agatikāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are without termination. {7/18 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Anabhisaṃskārāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are void of self-consciousness [things are not produced by co-operating causes]. {7/19 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Aprapañcāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are inert [indescribable]. {7/20 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:śūnyāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are empty [without any independent reality). {7/21 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Animittāḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are without any criterion or characteristic sign. {7/22 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Apraṇitaḥ sarva-dharmāḥ] all things are without wish desire or affection. {7/23 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}

[s:Anyonya-vivāda-saṃghṛīto batâyaṃ lokasanniveśo vyāpādakhila dveṣa-pratipanna iti saṃpaśyan] oh ! the inhabitants of the world being taken up by mutual disputes and quarrels have become injurious to and envious of each other: thus (Tathagata reflects) when looking on them. {7/24 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}

[s:Viparyāsa-saṃprayukto batâyaṃ loka-sanniveśo viśama-mārga-prayāta utpatha-mārga-sthāyī] oh ! the inhabitants of the world being false (or depraved) have taken a wrong way and continue to be [going] astray. {7/25 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}

[s:Lubdho lobhâbhibhūto-batâyaṃ loka-sanniveśo tṛptaḥ para-vittâpahārī] oh ! the inhabitants of this world being overtaken or subdued by every desire and covetousness are unsatisfied and are wishing to seize other's property. {7/26 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}

[s:Dhana-dhānya-gṛha-putra-bhāryā-tṛṣṇā-dāsā batê-me sattvā asāre sāra-saṃjñinaḥ] [alas ! slaves to the craving for riches, grains, houses, sons and wives, these beings perceive substance in things unsubstantial.] {7/27 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}

[s:Viṣamâjīvā batême sattvā anyonya-parivañcanôpasthitāḥ] oh ! these animate beings be-have themselves (or live) very improperly (or unbecomingly) by deceiving each other. {7/28 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}

[s:Atṛptā batême sattvā lābha-sat-kāra-ślokôpa-caritas tṛptāḥ sma iti pratijānate] unsatisfied (or not contented) are these animate beings, (though) they say when they have obtained their profit, reverence, and praise in verse, they are satisfied. {7/29 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}

[s:Nityâbhiratā batême sattvā ekânta-kliṣṭa-duḥkha bhājane gṛhâvāse] oh! these animate beings are always fond of their houses, the vessel [abode] of all sorts of distresses. {7/30 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}

[s:Kāraṇôpagāḥ punaḥ sarva-dharmāḥ viṭhapana-pratyupasthāna-lakṣaṇāḥ] again everything is produced-by efficient causes and when thus formed, it acquires the criterion of existence {7/31 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}

[s:Idam punar agram asaṇga-jñanam utsṛjya viśiṣṭa-parinirvānârthaṃ sattva hīna-yānaṃ prâthayante yad idam śrāvaka-pratekya-buddha-yānaṃ tebhya udāra-matiṃ rocayiṣyāmîti yad idaṃ buddha-jñānâdhyā-lambanatāyai tathāgatasya sattveṣu mahā-karuṇôtpadyate] the animate beings having all renounced this impartial, holy, excellent and emancipated wisdom, follow the low-principled doctrines of the śrāvakas and of the self-sainted ṛṣis. Therefore to make them know the wisdom of Buddha and to produce reverence in their mind for the great extent of his perfections, Tathāgata mercifully assists the animated beings [again, the beings, relinquishing the superior absolute knowledge, long for the narrow vehicle (hinayana), such as the method of the disciples and Pratyeka buddhas (śrāvaka-Pratyekabuddha-yana) for the attainment of a restricted form of Nirvāna; to them I will suggest the wide outlook for their adherence to (the path leading to) the knowledge of a Buddha : thus arises Tathāgata compassion for the beings]. {7/32 one The names or the thirty-two great mercies of Tathāgata}
[s:Triṇy āveṇikāni smṛty-upasthāna-namani] CLXXVI Names of the three kinds of self-recollection or equality of mind [absolute meditations]
[s:śuśrūṣamāṇeṣu sama-cittatā] equality of mind towards those that do hearken to him with reverence (or are anxious to hear him). {8/1 one མ་འདྲེས་པའི་དྲན་པ་ཉེ་བར་བཞག་པ་གསུམ་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Aśuśrūṣamāṇeṣu sama-cittatā] equality of mind towards those that do not hearken to him with due reverence. {8/2 one མ་འདྲེས་པའི་དྲན་པ་ཉེ་བར་བཞག་པ་གསུམ་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Suśruṣamāṇâśuśruṣamāṇeṣu sama-cittatā] equality of mind both towards those that hearken to him with reverence and [those] that do not. {8/3 one མ་འདྲེས་པའི་དྲན་པ་ཉེ་བར་བཞག་པ་གསུམ་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Catvary arakṣyāṅi] CLXXVII Names of four things without defence (or that are incontestable) [those that are not to be guarded against or warded off]

[s:Pariśuddha-kāya-samudā-cāras tathāgatah; nâsti tathāgatasyâpariśuddha-kāya-samudācāratā] all the bodily doings (or practices) of Tathagata, are pure; there is none among his works) that performances (or works) is not entirely pure. {9/1 one བསྲུང་མེད་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Pariśuddha-kāya-samudā-cāras tathāgatah; nâsti tathāgatasyâpariśuddha-kāya-samudācāratā] all the bodily doings (or practices) of Tathagata, are pure; there is none among his works) that performances (or works) is not entirely pure. {9/1 one བསྲུང་མེད་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Pariśuddha-kāya-samudā-cāras tathāgatah; nâsti tathāgatasyâpariśuddha-kāya-samudācāratā] all the bodily doings (or practices) of Tathagata, are pure; there is none among his works) that performances (or works) is not entirely pure. {9/1 one བསྲུང་མེད་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Pariśuddha-vāk-samudācāras tathāgatah; nâsti tathāgatasyâpariśuddha-vāk-samudācāratā] all the Commandments of Tathagata are very pure; there is none among the commands ofTathagata that is not entirely pure. {9/2 one བསྲུང་མེད་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Pariśuddha-vāk-samudācāras tathāgatah; nâsti tathāgatasyâpariśuddha-vāk-samudācāratā] all the Commandments of Tathagata are very pure; there is none among the commands ofTathagata that is not entirely pure. {9/2 one བསྲུང་མེད་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Pariśuddha-vāk-samudācāras tathāgatah; nâsti tathāgatasyâpariśuddha-vāk-samudācāratā] all the Commandments of Tathagata are very pure; there is none among the commands ofTathagata that is not entirely pure. {9/2 one བསྲུང་མེད་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Pariśuddha-manaḥ-samudācāras tathāgataḥ; nâsti tathāgatasyâpariśuddha-manaḥ-samudācāratā] all the thoughts (or mental operations) of Tathagata, are pure; there is none among his thoughts that is not entirely pure {9/3 one བསྲུང་མེད་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Pariśuddha-manaḥ-samudācāras tathāgataḥ; nâsti tathāgatasyâpariśuddha-manaḥ-samudācāratā] all the thoughts (or mental operations) of Tathagata, are pure; there is none among his thoughts that is not entirely pure {9/3 one བསྲུང་མེད་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Pariśuddha-jivās tathāgataḥ ; nâsti tathāgatasyâpariśuddha-jīvatā] the life (or manner of living) of Tathagata is very pure; there is nothing in his life that is not entirely pure. {9/4 one བསྲུང་མེད་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Pariśuddha-jivās tathāgataḥ ; nâsti tathāgatasyâpariśuddha-jīvatā] the life (or manner of living) of Tathagata is very pure; there is nothing in his life that is not entirely pure. {9/4 one བསྲུང་མེད་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Catvāri(catasraḥ ?) pratisaṃvidaḥ]: Names of four kinds of discrimination or understanding
[s:Dharma-pratisaṃvit] clear perception of the different doctrines (or religious articles). {10/1 one སོ་སོ་ཡང་དག་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Artha-pratisaṃvit] ཡང་དག་པར་རིག་པ་ clear understanding of the different meaning {10/2 one སོ་སོ་ཡང་དག་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Artha-pratisaṃvit] ཡང་དག་པར་རིག་པ་ clear understanding of the different meaning {10/2 one སོ་སོ་ཡང་དག་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Nirukti-pratisaṃvit] clear understanding of the truly different words [nirukta =etymological analysis; interpretation of the original language of the holy scriptures]. {10/3 one སོ་སོ་ཡང་དག་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Pratibhāna-pratisaṃvit] clear understanding of the (different) import or force. {10/4 one སོ་སོ་ཡང་དག་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Pañcâbhijñā-nāmāni] Names of five [?] kinds of evident perception or knowledge [supernatural powers or intuitional knowledge
[s:Para-citta-jñānam] knowledge of other's mind [thoughts] {11/3 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་ལྔའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Cetaḥ-paryāya-jñānam] knowledge of the synonymous terms for heart or mind. {11/4 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་ལྔའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Pūrva-nivāsânusmṛti jñānam] knowledge of recollecting the places of former abodes (in the several transmigrations). {11/5 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་ལྔའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:ṛddhi-vidhi-jñānam] knowledge of miraculous transformation. {11/6 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་ལྔའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Asrava-kṣaya-jñānam] knowledge of the absence of all imperfections; [D. 'knowledge how to destroy human passions']. {11/7 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་ལྔའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Abhijñā-karmāṇi:] CLXXX On the names (or terms) originating with the occasions (or circumstances) of the six[?] [kinds of] evident knowledg
[s:Yathā samāhite citte svīya āsane'ntarhitaḥ] he disappears from his seat as soon as he thinks in his mind. {12/1 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Vihāyasâbhyudgamya catur-vidham īryā-pathaṃ kalpayati] having lifted himself up in the air, exhibits four kinds of actions (or practices). {12/2 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Uparimaḥ kāyaḥ prajvalati] from the upper part of his body issues fire. {12/3 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Adhaḥ kāyac chītalā varidhārāḥ syandante] from the lower part of his body oozes a stream of cold water. {12/4 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Aneka-vidham-ṛdhi-viṣayaṃ pratyanubhavati] enjoys several sorts of plans of miraculous exhibitions. {12/5 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Eko bhūtvā bahudhā bhavati] after becoming single he becomes many (or after having changed himself into one he changes again into many). {12/6 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Bahudhā bhūtvā eko bhavati] being manifold he becomes single. {12/7 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Āvirbhavati tirobhāvamapi pratyanubhavati] from being evidently present he disappears. {12/8 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Tiraḥ-kudyaṃ tiraḥ-prākāram] he walks in an oblique posture on the side of a wall; ditto of an enclosure. {12/9 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Parvatam apy asajjamāno gacchati] he goes also unhindered through a hill or a mountain. {12/10 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Ākāśe vikramate tad yathā pakṣī śakunih] he walks (moves, goes, proceeds) in the void space above (or the air) as a winged bird. {12/11 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Pṛthivyām unmajjana-nimajjanaṃ karoti tad yathâpi nāmôdake] he sinks under the ground and heaves himself again as one does in water. {12/12 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Udake'py abhidyamāno gacchati tad yathâpi nāma mahā-pṛthivyām] he walks on water without sinking into it, as one walks on the [vast] continent or dry land. {12/13 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Dhūmayaty api prajvalaty api tad yathâpi nāma mahān agni-skandhaḥ] he also causes to arise smoke and flame as a great heap of fire. {12/14 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Sva-kāyād api mahā-yāridhārā utsṛjati tad yathâpi nāma mahāmeghaḥ] from (or out of) his body also he makes flow a large stream of water as a great cloud. {12/15 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Yābhir vāri-dhārābhir ayaṃ tri-sāhasra-mahā-sāhasro loka-dhātur ādīptaḥ pradīptaḥ saṃprajvalito 'gninā eka-jvalībhūto nirvāpyate] by those streams of water he quenches the fire that has broiled, burnt and involved into one common or universal flame all the three thousand of and great thousands regions (or mansions) of the world. {12/16 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Imāv api candra-sūryā mahardhika evaṃ-mahardhikā evaṃ mahânubhāvā evaṃ maha^ujaskau pāṇiṇā parāmṛṣati parimār-jayati] the moon and the sun also these so wonderful, so powerful (or efficacious) and so beautifully shining bodies, he touches with his hand and handles (or feels) them all over {12/17 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Yāvad brahma-lokād api sattvaṃ kāyena vaśe vartayati] [fn: M. sattvam. 5. sattvan in agreement with Tib.] and rules (or has power) over the body of all animate existences as far as the world of Brahma.

[s:Sâkāraṃ śôddeśaṃ sanidānaṃ pūrva-nivāsam anusmarati sma] together with the species (or kind of animate existences), together with the quarter (of the world where he lived) together with the causes thereof he recollects his former abodes (or residing places). {12/19 one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Jāti-smaraḥ] he recollects his several generations. {12/(i) one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Amutrâham āsam evaṃ-nāmā] at such a place I had such a name {12/(ii) one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Evaṃ-jātiḥ] such a caste (or I was of such and such a nation, tribe or caste) {12/(iii) one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Evaṃ-gotraḥ] such a family (or family extract) [extraction] {12/(iv) one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Evaṃ-āhāraḥ] I had such and such food {12/(v) one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Evaṃ-sukha-duḥkha-pratisaṃvedī] I have enjoyed such and such happiness or pleasure, and suffered such and such distress or pain {12/(vi) one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Evaṃ-cira-sthitikaḥ] I resided (remained) there for such and such a period of time {12/(vii) one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Evaṃ-āyuṣ-paryantaḥ] I obtained such and such a length of life (or my life extended thus far) {12/(viii) one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Tataś cyuto 'mutrôpapannaḥ] thence dying away I was born again at such and such a place {12/(ix) one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Tataś cyuta ihâpy upapannaḥ] thence changing (or shifting) my life by death I was born again here {12/(x) one མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་དྲུག་གི་སྐབས་ནས་བྱུང་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Trīṇi prātihāryāṇi] CLXXXI Names of the three kinds of juggle, or illusory shows [miracles or miraculous exhibitions]
[s:ṛddhi-prātihāryam] the trick of miraculous transformation [P. a wonder of psychic power] {1 one ཆོ་འཕྲུལ་གསུམ་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Adeśanā-prātihāryam] an illusory exhibition [P. trick or marvellous ability of mind-reading or guessing other people's character] {2 one ཆོ་འཕྲུལ་གསུམ་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Anuśānī-prātihāryam] the display of prodigies [P. the miracle of teaching, the wonder worked by the commandments (of the Buddha)] {3 one ཆོ་འཕྲུལ་གསུམ་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Bodhisattva-samādhayaḥ:] CLXXXII Names (or the predicates) of the deep meditation of a bodhisattva
[s:Supratiṣṭhitaḥ] the most firm or steady. {21/2 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཏིང་འཛིན་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Akampyaḥ] [fn: M. and S. Ākampyaḥ] not to be moved or immovable.
[s:Avinivartanīyaḥ] not ceasing, not desisting from. {21/4 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཏིང་འཛིན་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Ratnâkaraḥ] the mine (or source) of precious things (or jewels). {21/5 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཏིང་འཛིན་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Sūrya-prabha-tejaḥ] the brightness of the sunshine. {21/6 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཏིང་འཛིན་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Sarvârtha-siddhaḥ] the accomplishment of every desire. {21/7 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཏིང་འཛིན་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Jñānôlkaḥ] the light (or lamp) of wisdom. {21/8 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཏིང་འཛིན་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Pratyutpanna-buddha-saṃmukhâvasthitaḥ] the visible (or personal) presence of the Buddha of the present age. {21/9 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཏིང་འཛིན་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Bodhisattva-dhāraṇyaḥ:] CLXXXIII Names of the twelve faculties or capacities (dhāraṇī) [mystic charms] of a Bodhisattva
[s:Abhiṣecavatī] [fn: M: and S. Abhiṣecani] having a ruling power.
[s:Viśuddha-svara-nirghoṣā] having a very clear voice or melody. {22/3 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་གཟུངས་བཅུ་གཉིས་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Anantâvartā] infinite conglomeration (or gathering together of). {22/5 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་གཟུངས་བཅུ་གཉིས་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Sāgara-mudrā] having for his sign (or symbol) the sea or ocean. {22/6 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་གཟུངས་བཅུ་གཉིས་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Padma-vyūhā] [fn: MS. དཀོད་] having the delineation of a Padma flower. {22/7 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་གཟུངས་བཅུ་གཉིས་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Asaṅga-mukha-praveśā] entering by the door where there is no passion (or exempt from passion). {22/8 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་གཟུངས་བཅུ་གཉིས་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Pratisaṃvin-niścayâva-tārā] walking in true discrimination or understanding of things. {22/9 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་གཟུངས་བཅུ་གཉིས་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Buddhâlaṅkārādhiṣṭhitā] benediction, the ornament of a Buddha (or blessed by the benediction)་ {22/10 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་གཟུངས་བཅུ་གཉིས་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Buddha-kāya-varṇa-pari-niṣpatty-abhinirhārā] he that has obtained evidentlv the perfect colour of the body of Buddha. {22/12 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་གཟུངས་བཅུ་གཉིས་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Bodhisattva-vaśitāḥ:] CLXXXIV Names of those ten things which are in the power of a bodhisattva (or over which he has power) [names of the ten powers of a Bodhisattva]
[s:Āyur-vaśitā] he has faculty or power for (or over) life. {24/1 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་དབང་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Citta-vaśitā] he has faculty or power for (or over) the heart or mind. {24/2 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་དབང་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Pariṣkāra-vaśitā] he has faculty or power over utensils. {24/3 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་དབང་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Karma-vaśitā] he has faculty or power for (or over) works. {24/4 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་དབང་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Upapatti-vaśitā] he has faculty or power over birth {24/5 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་དབང་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Adhimukti-vaśitā] he has faculty or power over liberation (or faith). {24/6 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་དབང་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Dharma-vaśitā] he has faculty or power for religious instruction. {24/7 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་དབང་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Praṇidhāna-vaśitā] he has faculty or power for prayer. {24/8 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་དབང་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:ṛddhi-vaśitā] he has faculty or power for transformation. {24/9 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་དབང་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Jñāna-vaśitā] he has faculty or power for knowledge or wisdom. {24/10 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་དབང་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Bodhisattvānāṃ catvāri vaiśāradyāni:] CLXXXV Names of those four things in which a bodhisattva is bol

[s:Dhāraṇī-śrutôdgrahaṇârtha-nirdeśa-vaiśāradyam] having perceived the doctrine of wonderful comprehension he is bold in explaining (or teach characters of others, he is bold in keeping to the natural practice of those three wonderful works that are the most pure and the most perfect preservations. {25/1 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་མི་འཇིགས་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Nairātmyâdhigamāt para-viheṭhanā-nimitta-samu-dācāra-sahajânadhigatê-ryā-patha-tri-karma-pari-śuddha-mahā-rakṣa-saṃpanna-vaiśāradyam] having learned not to be egotist, leaving off the injurious character of others, he is bold in keeping to the natural practice of those three wonderfu; works that are the most pure and the most perfect preservation {25/2 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་མི་འཇིགས་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Sadôdgṛhīta-dharmâvismaraṇa-prajnôpāya-niṣṭhāgata-sattva-nistāraṇa-prasāda-saṃdarśana-śubhânantarāyika-vaiśāradyam] by not forgetting for a long time the perceived religious instruction by wise means and by an accomplished understanding, he is bold in liberating, illuminating and instructing the animate existences not to let their good works be interrupted. {25/3 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་མི་འཇིགས་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Sarva-jnātā-cittâsaṃpramo-ṣânya-yānâniryaṇa-saṃpūrṇa-vaśitā-sarva-prakāra-sattvârtha-saṃprāpaṇa-vaiśāradyam] being not relaxed in the spirit of all-wisdom, neither seduced by other principles, he is bold in accomplishing his organs (or powers) and in making the animate existences find completely in every respect their several concerns. {25/4 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་མི་འཇིགས་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Aṣṭādaśâveṇika-bodhisattva-dharmāḥ:] CLXXXVI Names of the eighteen pure (unmixed) laws of a Bodhisattv
[s:Anupadiśṭa-dānāḥ] they that are liberal without being taught to be so (not hypocrites in bestowing their alms). {26/1 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Anupadiṣṭa-śīlāḥ] they that are of strict moral conduct without being taught. {26/2 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Anupadiśṭa-kṣāntayaḥ] the uninstructed sufferers of hardships. {26/3 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Anupadiśṭa-vīryāḥ] they that are of diligent application without being instructed to be so (or they that are not hypocritical in their diligent application). {26/4 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Anupadiśṭa-dhyānāḥ] they that are contemplators without-being instructed. {26/5 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Anupadiśṭa-prajñāḥ] they that are ingenious (or witty) without being taught. {26/6 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Saṃgraha-vastu-sarva-sattva-saṃgrāhakāḥ] they that comprehend all animate existences under comprehensible (or material) properties. {26/7 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Pariṇāmaṇa -vidhijñāḥ] [fn: MS. °nāmaja°] they that are satisfied with receiving a benediction.

[s:Upāya-kauśalya-sarva-sattva-carita-vaśitā -paramayāna-niryāṇa-saṃdarśakaḥ] [fn: M. and S. caritâdhipatya°. Cf. M., p.13, footnote 3] they that show (or teach) on [in] a wise manner the origin of the highest principles (in philosophy) be derived from the tractices of the animate beings.
[s:Maha-yānâcyutāḥ] they that are [have] not swerved from the high principles [mahāyāna]. {26/10 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Saṃsāra-nirvāṇa-mukha-saṃdarśakaḥ] they that show (the door worldly existence and of final beatitude). {26/11 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Yamaka-vyatyâsthāra-kuśalaḥ] they that are skilful in mystical precepts delivered in chime or plain language. {26/12 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Jñāna-pūrvaṃgamânabhi-saṃskāra-niravadya-sarva-janmâbhimukha-pravṛttāḥ] they that are not elated with their proficiency in wisdom and without being defiled by sinful actions in all generations, make further progress. {26/13 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Daśa-kuśalôpeta-kāya-vāg-manas-karmântaḥ] possessing the ten virtues, the limits of bodily, verbal and mental actions or works. {26/14 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Sarva-duhkha-skandha-sahanâtmôpādāna-sarva-sattva-dhātv-aparityā-ginaḥ] [fn: M. °dhātu-parityāginaḥ. Tib. ཡོངས་སུ་མི་བཏང་བ་རྣམས་] they that have (received) a body capable of suffering all sorts of distress or pain and ginah that will not give up the abode of animal existences

[s:Sarva-jagad-abhirucita [S. °ruci. Cf. M., p. 13. footnote 5.]-saṃdarśakāḥ] they that teach all walking existences [jagat] to rejoice exceedingly. {26/16 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Kiyat-kṛcchra-bāla-śrāvaka-madhya-śubda-vyūha-ratna-kalpa-vṛkṣa-dṛḍha-savajñātā-cittâsampramuṣitāḥ] they that are firm (or steady) in the midst of children (fools) and hearers, like the kalpavṛkṣa among other precious trees and whose minds have not swerved from the All-knowing. {26/17 one བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་པའི་ཆོས་མ་འདྲེས་པ་བཅོ་བརྒྱད་ཀྱི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Sarva-dharma-paṭṭavâbaddhâbhiṣeka-prâpti-buddha-dharma] [Footnote: M. and S. add saṃgha here, the equivalent of which cannot be traced in Tib.]-paryeṣṭi-saṃdarśanânivṝttāḥ they that never desist to instruct [from instructing] those that seek for the doctrine of Buddha to make find them make them find] an entire command over all things by a wise method and charity (or liberality in bestowing alms).
[s:Catvāri saṃgraha-vastūni:] CLXXXVII Names of four properties (or qualities) to be acquire
[s:Samānârthaḥ] [fn: M. and S. °rthatā.] similarity of meaning.
[s:Trîṇi śikṣāṇi:] CLXXXVIII Names of three things (or maxims) to be learne
[s:Adhiśīlam] increase in good morals [D. training in the higher morality]. {32/1 one བསླབ་པ་གསུམ་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Adhicittam] increase in meditation [D. training in the higher thought]. {32/2 one བསླབ་པ་གསུམ་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Adhiprajñā] increase in understanding [D. training in the higher learning]. {32/3 one བསླབ་པ་གསུམ་གྱི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Catvāri prahāṇāni] CLXXXIX Names of four things to be avoided or observed sincerel

[s:Anutpannānāṃ pāpakānām akuśalānām dharmāṇām anutpādāyacchandaṃ janayati] to wish earnestly that the sins and immoral actions that have not yet come forth may not arise hereafter. {35/1 one ཡང་དག་པར་སྤོང་བ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Utpannānāṃ pāpakānām akuśalānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ prahāṇāyac chandaṃ janayati] to wish earnestly to leave off the sins and immoral actions that have arisen. {35/2 one ཡང་དག་པར་སྤོང་བ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Anutpannānāṃ kuśalānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ utpādāyac chandaṃ janayati] to wish earnestly virtues that have not yet come forth may be produced hereafter. {35/3 one ཡང་དག་པར་སྤོང་བ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Utpannānāṃ kuśalānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ sthitāya bhūyobhāvāya asaṃpramoṣāyaparipūraṇāyac chandaṃ janayati vyāyacchate vīryam ārabhate cittaṃ pragṛhṇāti samyak pradadhāti] to wish earnestly that the virtues or good morals that have taken their rise may continue, increase, [and may not deteriorate] and [may] come at [reach] the greatest perfection: (this wish) he re-makes news frequently, every endeavour [for], takes into his mind, and well retains it. {35/4 one ཡང་དག་པར་སྤོང་བ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Utpannānāṃ kuśalānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ sthitāya bhūyobhāvāya asaṃpramoṣāyaparipūraṇāyac chandaṃ janayati vyāyacchate vīryam ārabhate cittaṃ pragṛhṇāti samyak pradadhāti] to wish earnestly that the virtues or good morals that have taken their rise may continue, increase, [and may not deteriorate] and [may] come at [reach] the greatest perfection: (this wish) he re-makes news frequently, every endeavour [for], takes into his mind, and well retains it. {35/4 one ཡང་དག་པར་སྤོང་བ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Utpannānāṃ kuśalānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ sthitāya bhūyobhāvāya asaṃpramoṣāyaparipūraṇāyac chandaṃ janayati vyāyacchate vīryam ārabhate cittaṃ pragṛhṇāti samyak pradadhāti] to wish earnestly that the virtues or good morals that have taken their rise may continue, increase, [and may not deteriorate] and [may] come at [reach] the greatest perfection: (this wish) he re-makes news frequently, every endeavour [for], takes into his mind, and well retains it. {35/4 one ཡང་དག་པར་སྤོང་བ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Utpannānāṃ kuśalānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ sthitāya bhūyobhāvāya asaṃpramoṣāyaparipūraṇāyac chandaṃ janayati vyāyacchate vīryam ārabhate cittaṃ pragṛhṇāti samyak pradadhāti] to wish earnestly that the virtues or good morals that have taken their rise may continue, increase, [and may not deteriorate] and [may] come at [reach] the greatest perfection: (this wish) he re-makes news frequently, every endeavour [for], takes into his mind, and well retains it. {35/4 one ཡང་དག་པར་སྤོང་བ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Catvāra ṛddhi-pādāḥ] Names of four prodigious feats (wonderful art) [D. the four constituents of magic power]

[s:Chanda-samādhi-prahāṇa-saṃskāra samanvāgato ṛddhi-pādāḥ] [fn: S. °gata ṛddhi° in agreement with the rules of Sandhi] the wonderful art of relinquishing from his representation or consciousness the covetous deep meditation.

[s:Citta-samādhi-prahāṇa-saṃskāra samanvāgato ṛddhi-pādāḥ] [fn: S. °gata ṛddhi° in agreement with the rules of Sandhi] the wonderful art of relinquishing from his representation or consciousness the mental deep meditation.

[s:Virya-samādhi prahāṇa-saṃskāra samanvāgato ṛddhi-pādāḥ] [fn: S. °gata ṛddhi° in agreement with the rules of Sandhi] the wonderful art of relinquishing from his representation or consciousness the earnest application.

[s:Mīmāṃsā-samādhi-prahāṇa-saṃskāra samanvāgato ṛddhi-pādāḥ] [fn: S. °gata ṛddhi° in agreement with the rules of Sandhi] the wonderful art of relinquishing from his representation or consciousness the investigation.

[s:Mīmāṃsā-samādhi-prahāṇa-saṃskāra samanvāgato ṛddhi-pādāḥ] [fn: S. °gata ṛddhi° in agreement with the rules of Sandhi] the wonderful art of relinquishing from his representation or consciousness the investigation.
[s:Anupalambha-yogena bhavati [S. bhāvayati in agreement with Tib.] he meditates on with [in] an inconceivable manner. {36/5 one རྫུ་འཕྲུལ་གྱི་རྐང་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Anupalambha-yogena bhavati [S. bhāvayati in agreement with Tib.] he meditates on with [in] an inconceivable manner. {36/5 one རྫུ་འཕྲུལ་གྱི་རྐང་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Viveka-niśritam] he remains solitary (or in solitude). {36/6 one རྫུ་འཕྲུལ་གྱི་རྐང་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Virāga-niśritam] he is without passion. {36/7 one རྫུ་འཕྲུལ་གྱི་རྐང་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nirodha-niśritam] he is at cessation. {36/8 one རྫུ་འཕྲུལ་གྱི་རྐང་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Vyavasarga-pariṇatam] by leaving off he rules them all. {36/9 one རྫུ་འཕྲུལ་གྱི་རྐང་པ་བཞིའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Pratyeka-buddha-pudgalāḥ] CM [For རིམ་པའི་ S. has an alternative reading of གང་ཟག་ (pudgala).] མིང་ལ། Names of the self-sainted (pratyeka-buddha) ṛṣis' degree or kind
[s:Khaḍga-viṣāṇa-kalpaḥ] he that lives like a rhinoceros (in solitude) {1 one of རང་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་རིམ་པའི་}
[s:Varga-cārī] he that lives in society {2 one of རང་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་རིམ་པའི་}
[s:śrāvaka-bhūmayaḥ:] CXCII Names of the mansions (or degrees of perfection) of a hearer or śrāvaka
[s:śukla-vidarśanā-bhūmiḥ] the degree or ground of perceiving the white (or knowing what virtue is). {46/1 one ཉན་ཐོས་ཀྱི་སའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Darśana-bhūmiḥ] the degree of seeing (clearly) or the degree of speculation {46/4 one ཉན་ཐོས་ཀྱི་སའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Tanū-bhūmiḥ] the degree of subtilities (or of subtile speculation) {46/5 one ཉན་ཐོས་ཀྱི་སའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Vigata -rāga-bhūmiḥ] [fn: Vita° Cf. S.] the degree on which one is without passion
[s:Aśubha bhāvanāḥ] CXCIII Names or terms of the considerations of the disagreeable things (with respect to the body after death)
[s:Vinīlaka-saṃjñā] considering its becoming blue (dark blue). {48/1 one མི་སྡུག་པ་སྒོམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Vipūtika -saṃjñā] [fn: MS Vivatika°. M. Vipūyaka°. S. Vidhūtika° (vipūyaka).] considering its becoming purulent.
[s:Vipadumaka -saṃjñā] [fn: M. and S. Vipaḍumaka Cf. M., p. 19, footnote 1.] considering its being eaten or destroyed by worms.
[s:Vyādhmātaka-saṃjñā] considering its being burnt by fire. {48/4 one མི་སྡུག་པ་སྒོམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Vilohitaka-saṃjñā] considering its becoming red. {48/5 one མི་སྡུག་པ་སྒོམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Vikhāditaka-saṃjñā] considering its being eaten up (by worms). {48/6 one མི་སྡུག་པ་སྒོམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Vikṣiptaka-saṃjñā] considering its being scattered or cast away. {48/7 one མི་སྡུག་པ་སྒོམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Asthi-saṃjñā] [fn: Before this both M. and S. add Vidagdhaka-saṃjña (རྣམ་པར་ཚིག་པའི་འདུ་ཤེས་) which is, however. wanting in X.] consideration or reflection on its bones
[Anāpāna-bhāvanā-vidhiḥ ][fn: Cf. Visuddhimagga (PTS, VIII, 3) and The Path of Purity (PTS, VIII, ix).]On the names of the several degrees of letting out and taking in breath or or respiration
[s:Anāpāna-smṛtiḥ] remembering that breath enters and comes out. {49/1 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Vivartanā] [fn: S. རྣམ་པར་བསྒྱུར་བ་] changing or transforming {49/1 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Hrasvam āśvasan hrasvam āśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] [fn: Cf. S. which has a slightly different reading.] he knows very well the measure how short breathing must be followed by another short breathing {2 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:2A Hrasvam āśvasan praśvasan hrsvaṃ prāśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] {2A one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Dirghaṃ āśvasan dirghaṃ prāśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] he knows very well the measure [of] how it came that a long breathing was followed by another long breathing {3 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Dirghaṃ prāśvasan dirghaṃ prāśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] he knows very well the measure (or interval) [of] how it came that the utterance of a long breathing was succeeded by another long breathing {4 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Sarva-kāya-pratisaṃvedy āśvasan sarva-kāya-pratisaṃvedy āśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] it being the body that feels (perceives, enjoys) all, he knows well that when he has received a breath (or breathed in) it is the body which enjoys (or feels) everything, that has drawn in breath {5 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Sarva-kāya-pratisaṃvedī praśvasan sarva-kāya-pratisaṃvedī prāśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] it being the body that enjoys (or perceives) all, when a breath has been uttered he knows very well that the body being the organ of every sensation, it is the body that has breathed (or uttered a breath) {6 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Prasrabhya kāya-saṃskārān prasrabhya kāya-saṃskārān prāśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] the structure (or organisation) of the body being very refined (or perfect), when breath is drawn in he knows very well how it came that by the fine structure of the body breath was drawn in {7 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Prasrabhya kāya-saṃskārān praśvasan prasrabhya kāya-saṃskārān,prāśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] [fn: M. °saṃskārâṃ] the structure of the body being very fine, when breath is uttered he knows very well how it happens that breath is uttered on account of the fine structure of the. body

[s:Prīti-pratisaṃvedy āśvasan prīti-pratisaṃvedy āśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] having enjoyed (or felt) pleasure when breath is drawn in, he knows very well how it happens that by pleasure the breath is drawn in {9 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Prīti-pratisaṃvedī praśvasan prīti-pratisaṃvedī praśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] if he utters a breath when enjoying pleasure he knows very well how it happens that by the enjoyment of pleasure breath is uttered {10 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Citta-saṃskāra-pratisaṃvedy āśvasan citta-saṃskāra-pratisaṃvedy āśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] having clearly perceived an emotion of the mind during his drawing in a breath he knows very well how it happened that by the clear perception of the mind's emotion the breath was drawn in {11 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Citta-saṃskāra-pratisaṃvedī praśvasan citta-saṃskāra-pratisaṃvedī praśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] having clearly perceived an emotion of the mind during his protruding a breath, he knows very well how it happened that by the clear perception of the mind's emotion the breath was protruded (or uttered) {12 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Prasrabhya citta-saṃskārān āśvasan prasrabhya citta-saṃskārān āśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] the mind's emotion being well exercised (or purified) when he draws in breath he knows very well how it happened that by the mind being well exercised the breath is drawn in {13 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Prasrabhya citta-saṃskārān praśvasan prasrabhya citta-saṃskārān praśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] [fn: M. °kārām] [fn:: M. °kārām] the mind's emotion being well exercised (or purified) when he protrudes (or utters) a breath he knows very well how it happened that by the mind being well exercised, the breath has been uttered {14 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Citta-pratisaṃvedī āśvasan citta-pratisaṃvedy aśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] the mind being in pure enjoyment when breath was drawn in, he knows very well how it happened that by the mind's enjoyment the breath has been drawn in {15 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Citta-pratisaṃvedī praśvasān citta-pratisaṃvedī praśvasāmîti yathā-bhūtaṃ prajānāti] the mind being in perfect enjoyment when breath was uttered, he knows very well how it happened that by the mind's enjoyment the breath was uttered {16 one དབུགས་ཕྱི་ནང་དུ་རྒྱུ་བའི་རིམ་པའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Catvāry ārya-satyāni] the four excellent (venerable) truths. {50/1 one འཕགས་པའི་བདེན་པ་བཞི་རྣམ་པ་བཅུ་དྲུག་ཏུ་ཕྱེ་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Anātmakam] void of self-existence, soulless or void of personality. {50/5 one འཕགས་པའི་བདེན་པ་བཞི་རྣམ་པ་བཅུ་དྲུག་ཏུ་ཕྱེ་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Samudayaḥ] arising (or coming forth) always or everywhere. {50/6 one འཕགས་པའི་བདེན་པ་བཞི་རྣམ་པ་བཅུ་དྲུག་ཏུ་ཕྱེ་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Prabhavaḥ] first origin, primary cause, birth. {50/7 one འཕགས་པའི་བདེན་པ་བཞི་རྣམ་པ་བཅུ་དྲུག་ཏུ་ཕྱེ་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Pratyayaḥ] accessory cause, motive reason, apprehension, ascertainment, instrument. {50/9 one འཕགས་པའི་བདེན་པ་བཞི་རྣམ་པ་བཅུ་དྲུག་ཏུ་ཕྱེ་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nirodhaḥ] check, restraint, cessation, loss, destruction. {50/10 one འཕགས་པའི་བདེན་པ་བཞི་རྣམ་པ་བཅུ་དྲུག་ཏུ་ཕྱེ་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Niḥsaraṇam] the real (or certain) exit, death or dying, final beatitude. {50/13 one འཕགས་པའི་བདེན་པ་བཞི་རྣམ་པ་བཅུ་དྲུག་ཏུ་ཕྱེ་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Pratipattiḥ] getting, obtaining, completing, acquirement, ascertainment. {50/16 one འཕགས་པའི་བདེན་པ་བཞི་རྣམ་པ་བཅུ་དྲུག་ཏུ་ཕྱེ་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:N[a]iryāṇikaḥ] the way of eternal emancipation, or final beatitude. {50/17 one འཕགས་པའི་བདེན་པ་བཞི་རྣམ་པ་བཅུ་དྲུག་ཏུ་ཕྱེ་བའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Vimukti-mārgaḥ] the way of liberation or emancipation. {50/19 one འཕགས་པའི་བདེན་པ་བཞི་རྣམ་པ་བཅུ་དྲུག་ཏུ་ཕྱེ་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Abhisamayântikaṃ kuśala-mūlam] [fn: Cf. S.] virtue's root arising from judicious examination (or due reflection). {50/20 one འཕགས་པའི་བདེན་པ་བཞི་རྣམ་པ་བཅུ་དྲུག་ཏུ་ཕྱེ་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Abhisamayântikaṃ kuśala-mūlam] [fn: Cf. S.] virtue's root arising from judicious examination (or due reflection). {50/20 one འཕགས་པའི་བདེན་པ་བཞི་རྣམ་པ་བཅུ་དྲུག་ཏུ་ཕྱེ་བའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Kṣaya-jñāna-lābhikaṃ kuśala-mūlam] (it is) virtue's root to have acquired a knowledge of one'sdefects (of final cessation from worldly existence). {50/21 one འཕགས་པའི་བདེན་པ་བཞི་རྣམ་པ་བཅུ་དྲུག་ཏུ་ཕྱེ་བའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nirveda-bhāgīyaḥ] [fn: Nos. 22-26. classed under Nirvedha-bhaga-kramaḥ in both M. and S. LV.] being possessed of due discrimination.
[s:Uṣma-gatam] [fn: M. and S. °gataḥ°.] grown warm (earnestly desirous of).
[s:Mūrdhānam] the crown of the head, the top, acute. {50/24 one འཕགས་པའི་བདེན་པ་བཞི་རྣམ་པ་བཅུ་དྲུག་ཏུ་ཕྱེ་བའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:śodaśa citta-ksaṇāḥ:] CXCVI Names of the sixteen sudden reflections or thoughts of the min
[s:Duḥkhe dharma-jñāna-kṣāntiḥ] patience for the knowledge of virtue in (or with respect to) distress. {51/1 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Duḥkhe dharma-jñānam] knowledge of virtue in (or with respect to) distress. {51/2 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Duḥkhe 'nvaya-jñāna-kṣāntiḥ] patience to know how to judge (or discriminate) in distress. {51/3 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Duḥke'nvaya-jñānam] knowledge of making discrimination (or judicious reflection) in distress. {51/4 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Samudaye dharma-jñāna-kṣāntiḥ] patience for the knowledge of birth (or virtue, in every with every arising). {51/5 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Samudaye dharma-jñānam] knowledge of virtue in (or with respect to) every birth. {51/6 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Samudaye'nvaya-jñāna-kṣāntiḥ] patience to know how to judge(or discriminate) in every birth (or at every occasion). {51/7 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Samudaye'nvaya-jñānam] knowledge of making discrimination at every occasion. {51/8 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nirodhe dharma-jñāna-kṣāntiḥ] patience for the knowledge of virtue in (or with respect to) final cessation. {51/9 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nirodhe dharma-jñānam] knowledge of virtue (or doctrine) with respect to final cessation or stopping. {51/10 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nirodhe'nvaya-jñāna-kṣāntiḥ] patience for knowing how to discriminate or judge with respect to final cessation or stopping. {51/11 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Nirodhe'nvaya-jñānam] knowledge of making discrimination with respect to stopping (or final cessation). {51/12 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Mārge jñāna-kṣāntiḥ] patience to know the virtue (or doctrine) for the way. {51/13 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Mārge dharma-jñānam] knowledge of virtue (or doctrine) with respect to the way. {51/14 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Marge'nvaya-jñāna-kṣāntiḥ] patience for a judicious knowledge of the road or way. {51/15 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Marge'nvaya-jñāna-kṣāntiḥ] patience for a judicious knowledge of the road or way. {51/15 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Mārge'nvaya-jñānam] knowledge for making a judicious reflection with respect to the way. {51/16 one སེམས་སྐད་ཅིག་མ་བཅུ་དྲུག་གི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Dharma-jñānam] knowledge of virtue, morality, substance, property of things. {52/1 one ཤེས་པ་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Para-citta-jñānam] knowledge of another's mind. {52/2 one ཤེས་པ་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Anvaya-jñānam] knowledge of judicious discrimination. {52/3 one ཤེས་པ་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}

[s:Nirodha-jñānam] knowledge of cessation (or final stopping). {52/7 one ཤེས་པ་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Marga-jñānam] knowledge of the way (to final emancipation). {52/8 one ཤེས་པ་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Kṣaya-jñānam] knowledge of loss (cessation) or final destruction. {52/9 one ཤེས་པ་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
[s:Anutpāda-jñānam] knowledge of there being no new birth or regeneration. {52/10 one ཤེས་པ་བཅུའི་མིང་ལ་}
